channel.title: purescript on Bodacious Blog
channel.description: Recent content in purescript on Bodacious Blog

item.title: Learning PureScript
item.description: Source material Read PureScript by Example | Leanpub \ GitHub - paf31/purescript-book: Sources for the PureScript book \ Hack for backward compatibility | OCaml vs Haskell 1 ewwlinks +/"1.1 Functional JavaScript" "https://leanpub.com/purescript/read#leanpub-auto-functional-javascript" Type inference is supposed to be used as a tool. Functional programming is great at: data analysis, parsing, compiler implementation, generic programming, parallelism PureScript provides the ability to import existing JavaScript code, by providing types for its values and functions, and then to use those functions in regular PureScript code.

item.title: Setting up PureScript
item.description: Reading Make the Leap from JavaScript to PureScript - By Thoughts Because PureScript is cleaned up it might be a lot better, even if it’s less powerful. Haskell’s tooling must improve. Learn PureScript https://learnxinyminutes.com/docs/purescript/ https://github.com/adambard/learnxinyminutes-docs Set up tooling https://github.com/purescript/documentation pulp (build system for PureScript) https://github.com/purescript-contrib/pulp https://www.npmjs.com/package/pulp psc-package (Package manager for PureScript) Based on the concept of package sets. https://github.com/purescript/psc-package gulp-purescript https://github.
